channel.title: Data Science Portfolio on Roxana Butenco
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science Portfolio on Roxana Butenco

item.title: Project 4: Land Use Classification Map - Remote Sensing and Supervised Classification
item.description: Constructed a land cover map of County Dublin using supervised classification and a single-date satellite image followed by an accuracy assessment of the map output. The tools for completing this work were done using a suite of open source software, with a focus on the programming language – R. The urban land cover map was created by training machine learning algorithms - Random Forests and SVM - which were also used to predict land cover across our area of interest.

item.title: Project 3: Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence
item.description: In depth reporting and analysis of a business subject using data warehousing techniques from the operational data captured in the Microsoft training Northwind database.

item.title: Project 2: Applied Statistics – Regression Modelling
item.description: This project focuses on applying regression modelling on Boston dataset and predicting per capita crime rate using the other variables. Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: Project 1: Database Design and Development
item.description: Develop a 3NF (Third Normal Form) data model for Bank Corp Ltd(fictional company). Design and build a database to store and retrieve data for a business application. Create a single database to consolidate all the details into one single source. Focus on the technical design and provision of a new database server and the development of a new database for Bank Corp Ltd, accompanied with a Technical Design document. This project delivers the design and development of the database only.
